title: Added ability to change progress printer metric treatment
body: I added an additional (optional) keyword parameter to allow progress_printer to not treat the metric as a percentage. This will keep it from multiplying the metric by 100.0 in output in cases where the metric is not intended to be treated as a percentage.

title: Declare deleted functions public in C++ API header file.
body:
Declare deleted functions not private but public for better error messages.

Scott Meyers is saying in 'Effective Modern C++' (Item 11, page 75/76): 
>By convention, delete function are declared public, not private. ... will result in better error messages. There's a reason for that. When client code tries to use a member function, C++ checks accessibility before deleted status.

When a user tries to use a private deleted function, compiler complain about the function being private.
So, declaring deleted functions as not private but public results in better error messages.

title: restore_from_checkpoint description mistake

title: FastRCNN - Bad bonding box read when there is only one ground truth annotation
Add deviceId=localRank mode, enabling process select GPU by its local rank
body:
This commit add localRank option. Using this, mpi processes can select GPU base on their local rank.

To use:
`cntk configFile=... deviceId=localRank`

For example, if we launch 3 processed on 2 nodes
Process 0 on node 0 with local rank 0 will will try to pick GPU 0 on node 0
Process 1 and 2 with local rank 0 and 1 will try to pick GPU 0 and 1 on node 1

User can also manually select GPU in this mode by tweak GPU order on each node with environment variable in advance. Normally this is not needed, since faster and closer GPUs may have smaller and closer numbers.

This commit should cover most of use cases when user know the topology. If other cases needed, we are willing to work on those later. 

Note that due to MPI implementation, windows version is not covered in this commit.

title: add CPPEvalExtendedClient
body:
Using [Language Understanding Model](https://github.com/Microsoft/CNTK/blob/master/Examples/Text/ATIS/README.md) as example to show how to use extended eval interface and give the sequence input vectors to LU network.

Also using one input sentence "BOS i would like to find a flight from charlotte to las vegas that makes a stop in st. louis EOS" to show how to decode from LU model.

And, I am putting this example in Examples\Evaluation to avoid bring in regression for currently End2End test solution, we could move it to End2End test in future and also provide some demo data.

currently this program output will be:

```
Output dimension: 127
Output name: outputs
Input node name: featuresCW
Input feature dimension: 944
Input node name: featuresNW
Input feature dimension: 944
Input node name: featuresPW
Input feature dimension: 944
Slot tag for sentence "BOS i would like to find a flight from charlotte to las vegas that makes a stop in st. louis EOS" is as followings:
         i -- B-fromloc.airport_name
     would -- I-transport_type
      like -- I-transport_type
        to -- I-transport_type
      find -- I-transport_type
         a -- B-fromloc.airport_name
    flight -- I-transport_type
      from -- I-transport_type
 charlotte -- B-depart_date.day_name
        to -- I-transport_type
       las -- B-fromloc.airport_name
     vegas -- B-fromloc.airport_name
      that -- B-toloc.airport_name
     makes -- I-transport_type
         a -- B-toloc.airport_name
      stop -- I-transport_type
        in -- I-transport_type
       st. -- I-transport_type
     louis -- B-fromloc.airport_name
```

Tested both on Release_CPU & Debug_Cpu mode

title: NCCL support in SimpleDistGradAggregator
body:
Use NCCL collectives library (http://github.com/NVIDIA/nccl) to perform all reduce of 32- and 64-bit gradients when all MPI ranks 1) use GPUs and 2) reside on a common host.

Also use SimpleDistGradAggregator for 32- and 64-bit reductions even if CNTK was built with 1-bit SGD support.

title: CNTKTextFormatReader and SquareError node can now handle NaN labels
body:
This PR comprises the NaN-label subset of PR #719 (slightly adapted for CNTKTextFormatReader) and includes a UnitTest for image regression via reader composition as well as an E2E-Test for image regression with NaN-Labels (again using reader composition).

Notes:
1) If the label vector has NaN-labels, it may not be modified (e.g., scaled) by .ndl or brainscript. This restriction would be gone _if and only if_ the labels would be represented by (Q)NANs internally, see PR #719 for details.
2) For the E2E-Test, I used the "old" baseline from PR #719 (i.e., the plaintext config shown in the log file would not work, but the results are still the same). If that is undesired, a new baseline should be created via --create-baseline/--update-baseline
3) The tests are currently written in .ndl O:-) (sorry)
4) Tested on Win8.1 and Win10 with Cuda8.0 RC and cudnn5.0 (it seems that GTX1080 is incompatible with Cuda7.5, so I cannot easily test it with Cuda7.5 myself). Since all tests pass, it should be fine, though.

Best,
Daniel

title: Avoid double definition of atomicAdd on modern GPUs
body:
NVIDIA finally implemented the double version of atomicAdd for Pascal. Hence the "custom" atomicAdd version must be excluded from compilation for these GPUs, otherwise it will be defined twice (and the compiler will complain).

Side note: @mahilleb-msft 's branch mahilleb/CuDnn5Test (recommended by @chrisbasoglu ) plus this small change made me able to compile and run CNTK successfully with a GTX1080 (Cuda 8.0 RC and cudnn 5.0).

See Issue #655.

title: add example that show how to use extended eval interface
body: add example that show how to use extended eval interface to load a LSTM network, also show how to give input sequence vectors to LSTM.

title: Added support for regression in ImageDataDeserializer
body:
**This is pull request is related to Issue #422.**

**The main contribution of this pull request:**

It is now possible to use ImageDataDeserializer (or ImageReader) to read regression labels. This works in both the "corpus" and the "old deprecated" way, namely:
- in the .cntk config file, set the (global) parameter "labelType = regression" (default is "classification"; maybe "category" could be added as a valid input as well, but I have not done so, yet)
- labelDim has to be provided: it is the length of the label vector (basically the same as for "classification")
- in the mapping file, simply write the tab-separated labels after the image path, see the two simple UnitTests I added for an example.

**An addition to the above:**

(Parts of) the labels can now also be "NAN" (or "nan" or "NaN" etc.). Any NAN labels are internally translated to std::numeric_limits<Precision>::lowest() (because it seems that cuda does not handle (Q)NAN really well). I would have loved to do it with NAN directly, but gave up after two weeks (I am not a CUDA expert though, so it may actually be possible, and it would definitely be nicer/cleaner). Anyway, these specific std::numeric_limits<Precision>::min() values are later ignored during the computation of the (square) loss and also during back-propagation. The caveat here is that this cannot be used in conjunction with any .ndl options for scaling the labels (or generally modifications), since it would quickly result in some sort of underflow. Features are not affected and can be scaled the same way as before.

This is not an essential part of "Image Regression" in general. So if that specific part raises some eyebrows or is not desirable on your part, I can remove it from the pull request. However, I find it is a useful feature for image regression, especially when trying to combine several databases (which may have different subsets of labels and thus some of them are unknown -> NAN), for example.

If you find that there are other issues or if you have questions, feel free to let me know and I can try to resolve them.

**Final remark:**

I had to merge the things manually since there were a lot of conflicts. Therefore, there is no visible history of the branch I merged with (thankfully, the 'lost' history is not too long, though).
You can find most of it here: https://github.com/DanielMerget/CNTK/tree/special_square_loss_layer
The UnitTests are from here: https://github.com/DanielMerget/CNTK/tree/image_regression

Best,
Daniel

title: bugfix: multiview in ImageReader now disabled by default (as intended)
body: An empty string will (curiously) be mapped to CropType::Multiview10 instead of CropType::Center. This is #1 unintuitive and #2, for regression tasks, this is never desirable since it would result in wrongly labeled images.

title: bugfix: grayscale image now assumed by default if number of channels …
body: Using ImageReader with grayscale images crashes CNTK unless the reader parameter "grayscale=true" is set in the cntk config. However, CNTK should be smart enough to (by default) read grayscale images if the number of channels in the feature section of the reader is one anyway (channels=1).

title: baseline
body: baseline

title: FIXED: error: expected ')' before 'PRIu64' on Linux CPU-only
body:
When compiling CPU-only flavor of CNTK on Linux it fails to build because of

```
error: expected ')' before 'PRIu64'
```

Solution, replaced all:

```
#include <stdint.h>
```

with:

```
#define __STDC_FORMAT_MACROS
#include <inttypes.h>
```

which include the #include <stdint.h> and also define PRIu64.

And I also fixed an file path issue in EvalWrapper project.

Peace and Long Life,
Boris

title: Stdc format macros fix
body:
#348

I found the problem. Take this code for example:
https://github.com/Microsoft/CNTK/blame/8322296eabac5899df10d320fe9313169420b7de/Source/Readers/CNTKTextFormatReader/TextParser.cpp

And this error...

mpic++ -c Source/CNTK/BrainScript/BrainScriptParser.cpp -o /home/hadoop/ldmtwo/bin/cntk_20160413/cntk/build/release/.build/Source/CNTK/BrainScript/BrainScriptParser.o -D_POSIX_SOURCE -D_XOPEN_SOURCE=600 -D__USE_XOPEN2K -std=c++11 -DCPUONLY -DUSE_MKL -DNDEBUG -DNO_SYNC  -DUSE_ZIP -msse3 -std=c++0x -fopenmp -fpermissive -fPIC -Werror -fcheck-new -Wno-error=literal-suffix -g -O4 -ISource/Common/Include -ISource/Math -ISource/CNTK -ISource/ActionsLib -ISource/ComputationNetworkLib -ISource/SGDLib -ISource/SequenceTrainingLib -ISource/CNTK/BrainScript -ISource/Readers/ReaderLib -I/opt/intel/mkl/include -I/usr/local/lib/libzip/include -I/usr/local/opencv-3.0.0/include -MD -MP -MF /home/hadoop/ldmtwo/bin/cntk_20160413/cntk/build/release/.build/Source/CNTK/BrainScript/BrainScriptParser.d
Source/Readers/CNTKTextFormatReader/TextParser.cpp:1087:34: error: expected ‘)’ before ‘PRId64’
             " at the offset = %" PRId64 "\n", GetFileOffset());
                                  ^
Thanks to @jack-unisound for the suggestion. Looking at the history of the files not compiling, it was after @raaaar added TextParser.cpp and others. I don't know why it's working for other people, but these suggest adding #define __STDC_FORMAT_MACROS or #define __STDC_FORMAT_MACROS 1 because the default is to not define it.

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/14535556/why-doesnt-priu64-work-in-this-code
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/8132399/how-to-printf-uint64-t
http://www.leoox.com/?p=229

To test this theory, I modified these files.

1001 nano Source/Readers/CNTKTextFormatReader/Indexer.cpp
1002 nano Source/Readers/CNTKTextFormatReader/TextParser.cpp
1003 nano Source/Readers/ImageReader/ImageDataDeserializer.cpp
1004 nano Source/Readers/ExperimentalHTKMLFReader/MLFDataDeserializer.cpp
1005 nano Source/Readers/ReaderLib/SequencePacker.cpp
1006 nano Source/Common/Include/latticearchive.h

Added this before inttypes was included:
# ifndef __STDC_FORMAT_MACROS
# define __STDC_FORMAT_MACROS
# endif

latticearchive.h already had the definition, so I had to add #ifndef

title: Makefile and configure changes for docker and for using alternative install paths

I don't expect you to merge this pull request, just using it to communicate some changes that seem effective to me, for you to consider in your next linux release.  Explanation of each change follows:

Makefile:109 -- this is needed for docker image builds, as the base nvidia docker images put libcuda.so in a slightly different place than expected.

Makefile: 125-129 -- these lines permit install of the ACML package in a different location.  one var, ACML_PATH, can now be set and libs in both ifort64 adn ifort64_mp will be picked up

configure:13 -- companion change needed for the makefile change above

configure:489 -- this is just a bug fix

After change learningRatesPerMD from 0.5 to 0.05, the error rate goes to 1% (Original error rate is about 90%).

title: Py3K compliant TestDriver
body: Based on TestDriver.py, I ran 2to3 and applied some modifications so that it runs with Python 3. Eventually, one could merge both versions and use the six module to work around incompatibilities.

title: MaxGpus was hardcoded to 8 GPUs
body: Increasing the limit to 16 to support a K80 CS-Storm node; MAX_GPUS can be used to define this value at compile time.

title: Fix Kaldi2Reader building.
body:
1. adding new virtual function. but this is just to fix compile issue, for multi utt support, need more work.
2. Someone remove a '}". Just add it back.

title: Upgrade the cuDNN version from 4.0 rc to 4.0 prod
Added reinterpret_cast<long int*>(&info) to [d,s]gesvd() of CPUMatrix.cpp
body: Wasn't working for me using the `gcc` version of `mpic++`, so I had to add this in.

title: Mac port
body:
These change made it possible for me to build CNTK on OS X 10.11.3. Just a single commit deals with Mac-specific changes, the others correct non-standard linking behaviour that depends on luck and compiler implementation details (I'm surprised CNTK even links on Windows and Linux).

I based this PR on f628e52de2ea1fe91a0a87de107bdcf384679ef0 because the Linux build is currently broken in master. I'll rebase this PR as soon as this is fixed.

I could only test the CPU-only version because I don't have an Nvidia GPU. On the other hand, I set up CI to test the changes with GCC 4.9 and 5.3 both on Linux and Mac, so I'm pretty confident they don't break anything (see [Travis CI](https://travis-ci.org/jpauwels/CNTK/builds/107701923)). Now I'd like someone to verify on a Windows machine.

In order to build on a Mac, you need an `mpic++` that is built with GCC, which doesn't come standard with OS X. If you have homebrew, you can do: `brew install gcc --without-multilib` and then `brew install --cc=gcc openmpi`. You also need Intel MKL, because ACML is not available for Mac, but the former is [freely available](https://software.intel.com/sites/campaigns/nest/) too (since recently).

title: Added missing quote in case OPENCV_PATH contains spaces.
Fixed the build errors (on Linux):
body:
- Wrong format string types.
- Default argument values should be in header, not .cpp.

title: Add node 'ClassPrediction(labels,output)'
body: Add node 'ClassPrediction(labels,output)' to conveniently output a net's predictions together with the corresponding labels. See MNIST examples for usage.

title: Input(2)->HasMBLayout
body: Was same condition twice: `!Input(0)->HasMBLayout() || !Input(0)->HasMBLayout()`

title: forgot `throw` keyword
body: exception must be thrown, not just created

title: Update README.md
body: Fixed typos

title: Merge pull request #2 from Microsoft/master
body: Update from original

title: Add experimental support for OpenBLAS library
body:
- Add 'openblas' as mathlib option in configure. Not added to auto-search so
  must be specified using --with-openblas
- configure script searches outside of tail so that libraries at default_path_list
  roots (ie /usr/local/openblas_config.h) are found
- Treat ACML as the odd library out in ifdefs since it doesn't conform to typical
  BLAS standard. Other libraries like ATLAS should be able to share
  OpenBLAS/MKL variants. Add default USE_ACML define in VS projects to match
- Fix 'max' macro define colliding with C++ std::max once openblas headers are included

Usage Notes:
- For best performance, build OpenBLAS with USE_OPENMP=1. When running CNTK, define
  OPENBLAS_NUM_THREADS=#physical cores in environment or performance will suffer
- OpenBLAS 2.16 (git HEAD) tested in Linux with GCC 4.8.4 and in Windows with
  OpenBLAS 2.15 (pre-built binary release + MingGW 64-bit support dlls)
- For Windows, in Math.vcxproj, replace libacml_mp_dll.lib with libopenblas.dll.a and remove
  USE_ACML define. Change ACML_PATH environment variable to your OpenBLAS path.
  Modify openblas_config.h as per xianyi/OpenBLAS#708
- On current generation Intel processors, OpenBLAS measures a little faster than
  AMD ACML and slower than Intel MKL on MNIST and other examples

title: Add printMetadata flag to the dumpnode action.
body:
This flag lets the dumpnode action to write only values of the node to the file. This is useful for dumping the learnable parameters and subsequent processing, e.g. converting to binary and consuming in the SR engine. The default value is true.

This is example usage

DumpnodeA=[
     action=dumpnode
     modelPath=\somepath
     nodeName="LSTMoutput1.bits"
     printMetadata=false
     outputFile=D:\output
}

title: Fix the compile issue for Kaldi2Reader.
body: Simply pass an empty string to latticesource (we are not really using it, so it's OK).

body: Spellchecked Documentation/CNTK-TechReport/lyx/*.lyx

title: Add Markdown versions of documentation Word files
body:
I went through and converted each .docx file in the Documentation/Documents folder into a Markdown file. Having documentation that is easily viewable and navigable on the web will be incredibly important if this open source effort is going to succeed. There will inevitably need to be changes and upgrades to these files, but I think this is a good first step.

I understand that there's a lot to look at, so taking a look at the rendered files will be the easiest way to make sure nothing looks screwy. Here are direct links to the files on my fork:
- [Configuration Files](https://github.com/samjabrahams/CNTK/blob/markdown-docs/Documentation/Documents/Configuration%20Files.md)
- [ExternalBuffer in Matrix class](https://github.com/samjabrahams/CNTK/blob/markdown-docs/Documentation/Documents/External%20Buffer%20Behavior.md)
- [Model Editing Language](https://github.com/samjabrahams/CNTK/blob/markdown-docs/Documentation/Documents/Model%20Editing%20Language.md)
- [Network Description Language](https://github.com/samjabrahams/CNTK/blob/markdown-docs/Documentation/Documents/Network%20Description%20Language.md)

_Note: while I may have made a few fixes, capitalization fixes, etc. while going through these files, I did not edit them for content. Fixing existing typos and grammatical errors was not the purpose of this PR._
